intro: Alsine decandra, commonly known as slender alsike, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Caryophyllaceae. It is native to Europe and parts of Asia, often found in moist meadows and along riverbanks. The plant produces small, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in early summer. Its leaves are narrow and slightly hairy, and it has a fibrous root system. Alsine decandra is typically perennial and can thrive in a variety of soil types.
